messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Shrek
messages.msgSnippet: my 4 yr.old has watched shrek 1 over and over all day every day untill he wore the darn thing out! now he plays the shrek 2 game over and over and over! I have
messages.messageBody:
my 4 yr.old has watched shrek 1 over and over all day every day untill he wore
the darn thing out!
now he plays the shrek 2 game over and over and over! I have got to go buy shrek 2
for him and see how that goes between shrek the game and shrek the movie!
hugs~Pat

huntmom1996 <jechunt@...> wrote:

Thanks everyone....I am trying to go with the movie watching. I
watched it, too, and thinks it's good, but am in my own tv-resistant
phase, so I am sure that has something to do with my attitude.

Your responses have been very helpful. I feel strongly that this
will be so wonderful once we get into the rhythm of freedom. Dd goes
to sleep late, after getting very overtired/weepy/cranky, but most
days can sleep late and I am sure that the emotion will even out once
it becomes a routine.

I will ahve to pass on your watching records to the Blockbuster guy!
He told me three viewings was a local record. I guess those other
kids were wasting their time in school LOL.

Jessica

messages.messageBody:
Thanks everyone....I am trying to go with the movie watching. I
watched it, too, and thinks it's good, but am in my own tv-resistant
phase, so I am sure that has something to do with my attitude.

Your responses have been very helpful. I feel strongly that this
will be so wonderful once we get into the rhythm of freedom. Dd goes
to sleep late, after getting very overtired/weepy/cranky, but most
days can sleep late and I am sure that the emotion will even out once
it becomes a routine.

I will ahve to pass on your watching records to the Blockbuster guy!
He told me three viewings was a local record. I guess those other
kids were wasting their time in school LOL.

Jessica
